title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message:
Machine arrived no greenlight so I tookout the mlb and when i plugged it in it worked. So I put it back in the machine and sure enough it worked fine.
Except for not detecting a battery, I couldnt see any corrosion on the board despite this being milk damaged. So I decided to ultrasonic it.

Now the machine boots but gets stuck on apple loading screen, but if i press capslock it lights up and if i press other keys it makes that beep noise.

So seems like the machine is booting but display is getting stuck on the apple boot logo?

Resoldered u8900 no change in results.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: Ugh these symptoms always suck. Only thing to do is look where the corrosion was and find the corroded trace/resistor. Maybe crap under a chip too.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: Are there any specific areas/circuits I should go over?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message:
Video area/MUXes/GPU power. I have a board with similar issues here, been here for over a year. Still not scrapped it as I have hope that one day......
Does it boot EFI ASD version?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message:
Can I join the party? I have a board here since more than two months, resoldered and replaced U8900, replaced GPU but nothing. It is always stuck on the Apple logo. Replaced and reflashed BIOS, still nothing.

No liquid damage or repair history.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: Passes EFI ASD no prob. Same prob with OS ASD though stuck on loading apple

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: Nothing I can help with besides saying find the corrosion. These symptoms suck.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: I'll try going over the whole board again. So annoying when it's so close to working

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message: Had one with this issue today. Was only a dead SMC to start, but idiots came before me and fucked with the GPU. Redid the GPU and VRAM and now it boots up fine again. Quite a pain in the ass to do the VRAM on these I must warn with tight clearance to parts and glue.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A Screen stuck on boot apple logo
message:
VRAM reflow did the trick, someone replaced the screw mount for the GPU heatsink and directly on the otherside was VRAM so i guess since it still had the glue round it it messed up the balls.

After removing glue and a reflow all is well. Thanks [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]
